 179          """

 182          Arguments: 
 183

 186              login: sender login name and password in login:password notation 
 187                     or None if no authentication is required

 189   
 190          In Google App Engine use:

 192              server='gae' 
 193   
 194          For sake of backward compatibility all fields are optional and default 
 195          to None, however, to be able to send emails at least server and sender 
 196          must be specified. They are available under following fields: 
 197   
 198              mail.settings.server 
 199              mail.settings.sender 
 200              mail.settings.login 
 201   
 202          When server is 'logging', email is logged but not sent (debug mode) 
 203   
 204          Optionally you can use PGP encryption or X509: 
 205   
 206              mail.settings.cipher_type = None 
 207              mail.settings.gpg_home = None 
 208              mail.settings.sign = True 
 209              mail.settings.sign_passphrase = None 
 210              mail.settings.encrypt = True 
 211              mail.settings.x509_sign_keyfile = None

 214              mail.settings.x509_crypt_certfiles = None 
 215   
 216              cipher_type       : None 
 217                                  gpg - need a python-pyme package and gpgme lib 
 218                                  x509 - smime 
 219              gpg_home          : you can set a GNUPGHOME environment variable 
 220                                  to specify home of gnupg 
 221              sign              : sign the message (True or False) 
 222              sign_passphrase   : passphrase for key signing 
 223              encrypt           : encrypt the message 
 224                               ... x509 only ... 
 225              x509_sign_keyfile : the signers private key filename (PEM format) 
 226              x509_sign_certfile: the signers certificate filename (PEM format) 
 227              x509_nocerts      : if True then no attached certificate in mail

 232          Examples: 
 233

 271          """ 
 272          Sends an email using data specified in constructor 
 273   
 274          Arguments: 
 275   
 276              to: list or tuple of receiver addresses; will also accept single 
 277                  object 
 278              subject: subject of the email 
 279              message: email body text; depends on type of passed object: 
 280                       if 2-list or 2-tuple is passed: first element will be 
 281                       source of plain text while second of html text; 
 282                       otherwise: object will be the only source of plain text 
 283                       and html source will be set to None; 
 284                       If text or html source is: 
 285                       None: content part will be ignored, 
 286                       string: content part will be set to it, 
 287                       file-like object: content part will be fetched from 
 288                                         it using it's read() method 
 289              attachments: list or tuple of Mail.Attachment objects; will also 
 290                           accept single object 
 291              cc: list or tuple of carbon copy receiver addresses; will also 
 292                  accept single object 
 293              bcc: list or tuple of blind carbon copy receiver addresses; will 
 294                  also accept single object 
 295              reply_to: address to which reply should be composed 
 296              encoding: encoding of all strings passed to this method (including 
 297                        message bodies) 
 298              headers: dictionary of headers to refine the headers just before 
 299                       sending mail, e.g. {'Return-Path' : 'bounces@example.org'} 
 300   
 301          Examples: 
 302   
 303              #Send plain text message to single address: 
 304              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 305                        'Message subject', 
 306                        'Plain text body of the message') 
 307   
 308              #Send html message to single address: 
 309              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 310                        'Message subject', 
 311                        '<html>Plain text body of the message</html>') 
 312   
 313              #Send text and html message to three addresses (two in cc): 
 314              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 315                        'Message subject', 
 316                        ('Plain text body', '<html>html body</html>'), 
 317                        cc=['other1@example.com', 'other2@example.com']) 
 318   
 319              #Send html only message with image attachment available from 
 320              the message by 'photo' content id:

 322                        'Message subject', 
 323                        (None, '<html><img src="cid:photo" /></html>'), 
 324                        Mail.Attachment('/path/to/photo.jpg' 
 325                                        content_id='photo')) 
 326   
 327              #Send email with two attachments and no body text 
 328              mail.send('you@example.com, 
 329                        'Message subject', 
 330                        None, 
 331                        [Mail.Attachment('/path/to/fist.file'), 
 332                         Mail.Attachment('/path/to/second.file')])

 334          Returns True on success, False on failure. 
 335   
 336          Before return, method updates two object's fields: 
 337          self.result: return value of smtplib.SMTP.sendmail() or GAE's 
 338                       mail.send_mail() method 
 339          self.error: Exception message or None if above was successful

 342          def encode_header(key): 
 343              if [c for c in key if 32>ord(c) or ord(c)>127]: 
 344                  return Header.Header(key.encode('utf-8'),'utf-8') 
 345              else: 
 346                  return key

 348          # encoded or raw text 
 349          def encoded_or_raw(text): 
 350              if raw: 
 351                  text = encode_header(text) 
 352              return text

 354          if not isinstance(self.settings.server, str): 
 355              raise Exception('Server address not specified') 
 356          if not isinstance(self.settings.sender, str): 
 357              raise Exception('Sender address not specified')

 359          if not raw: 
 360              payload_in = MIMEMultipart.MIMEMultipart('mixed') 
 361          else: 
 362              # no encoding configuration for raw messages 
 363              if isinstance(message, basestring): 
 364                  text = message.decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 365              else: 
 366                  text = message.read().decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 367              # No charset passed to avoid transport encoding 
 368              # NOTE: some unicode encoded strings will produce

 371          if to:

 394              attachment = MIMEMultipart.MIMEMultipart('alternative') 
 395              if not text is None:

 417          ####################################################### 
 418          #                      CIPHER                         # 
 419          ####################################################### 
 420          cipher_type = self.settings.cipher_type 
 421          sign = self.settings.sign 
 422          sign_passphrase = self.settings.sign_passphrase 
 423          encrypt = self.settings.encrypt 
 424          ####################################################### 
 425          #                       GPGME                         # 
 426          ####################################################### 
 427          if cipher_type == 'gpg': 
 428              if self.settings.gpg_home: 
 429                  # Set GNUPGHOME environment variable to set home of gnupg 
 430                  import os 
 431                  os.environ['GNUPGHOME'] = self.settings.gpg_home 
 432              if not sign and not encrypt: 
 433                  self.error="No sign and no encrypt is set but cipher type to gpg" 
 434                  return False 
 435   
 436              # need a python-pyme package and gpgme lib 
 437              from pyme import core, errors 
 438              from pyme.constants.sig import mode 
 439              ############################################ 
 440              #                   sign                   # 
 441              ############################################ 
 442              if sign: 
 443                  import string 
 444                  core.check_version(None) 
 445                  pin=string.replace(payload_in.as_string(),'\n','\r\n') 
 446                  plain = core.Data(pin) 
 447                  sig = core.Data() 
 448                  c = core.Context() 
 449                  c.set_armor(1) 
 450                  c.signers_clear() 
 451                  # search for signing key for From: 
 452                  for sigkey in c.op_keylist_all(self.settings.sender, 1): 
 453                      if sigkey.can_sign: 
 454                          c.signers_add(sigkey) 
 455                  if not c.signers_enum(0): 
 456                      self.error='No key for signing [%s]' % self.settings.sender 
 457                      return False 
 458                  c.set_passphrase_cb(lambda x,y,z: sign_passphrase) 
 459                  try: 
 460                      # make a signature 
 461                      c.op_sign(plain,sig,mode.DETACH) 
 462                      sig.seek(0,0) 
 463                      # make it part of the email 
 464                      payload=MIMEMultipart.MIMEMultipart('signed', 
 465                                                          boundary=None, 
 466                                                          _subparts=None, 
 467                                                          **dict(micalg="pgp-sha1", 
 468                                                                 protocol="application/pgp-signature")) 
 469                      # insert the origin payload 
 470                      payload.attach(payload_in) 
 471                      # insert the detached signature 
 472                      p=MIMEBase.MIMEBase("application",'pgp-signature') 
 473                      p.set_payload(sig.read()) 
 474                      payload.attach(p) 
 475                      # it's just a trick to handle the no encryption case 
 476                      payload_in=payload 
 477                  except errors.GPGMEError, ex: 
 478                      self.error="GPG error: %s" % ex.getstring() 
 479                      return False 
 480              ############################################ 
 481              #                  encrypt                 # 
 482              ############################################ 
 483              if encrypt: 
 484                  core.check_version(None) 
 485                  plain = core.Data(payload_in.as_string()) 
 486                  cipher = core.Data() 
 487                  c = core.Context() 
 488                  c.set_armor(1) 
 489                  # collect the public keys for encryption 
 490                  recipients=[] 
 491                  rec=to[:] 
 492                  if cc: 
 493                      rec.extend(cc) 
 494                  if bcc: 
 495                      rec.extend(bcc) 
 496                  for addr in rec: 
 497                      c.op_keylist_start(addr,0) 
 498                      r = c.op_keylist_next() 
 499                      if r is None: 
 500                          self.error='No key for [%s]' % addr 
 501                          return False 
 502                      recipients.append(r) 
 503                  try: 
 504                      # make the encryption 
 505                      c.op_encrypt(recipients, 1, plain, cipher) 
 506                      cipher.seek(0,0) 
 507                      # make it a part of the email 
 508                      payload=MIMEMultipart.MIMEMultipart('encrypted', 
 509                                                          boundary=None, 
 510                                                          _subparts=None,

 514                      payload.attach(p) 
 515                      p=MIMEBase.MIMEBase("application",'octet-stream') 
 516                      p.set_payload(cipher.read()) 
 517                      payload.attach(p) 
 518                  except errors.GPGMEError, ex: 
 519                      self.error="GPG error: %s" % ex.getstring() 
 520                      return False 
 521          ####################################################### 
 522          #                       X.509                         # 
 523          ####################################################### 
 524          elif cipher_type == 'x509': 
 525              if not sign and not encrypt: 
 526                  self.error = "No sign and no encrypt is set but cipher type to x509" 
 527                  return False 
 528              x509_sign_keyfile = self.settings.x509_sign_keyfile 
 529              if self.settings.x509_sign_certfile: 
 530                  x509_sign_certfile = self.settings.x509_sign_certfile 
 531              else: 
 532                  # if there is no sign certfile we'll assume the 
 533                  # cert is in keyfile 
 534                  x509_sign_certfile = self.settings.x509_sign_keyfile 
 535              # crypt certfiles could be a string or a list 
 536              x509_crypt_certfiles = self.settings.x509_crypt_certfiles 
 537              x509_nocerts = self.settings.x509_nocerts 
 538   
 539              # need m2crypto 
 540              try: 
 541                  from M2Crypto import BIO, SMIME, X509 
 542              except Exception, e: 
 543                  self.error = "Can't load M2Crypto module" 
 544                  return False 
 545              msg_bio = BIO.MemoryBuffer( payload_in.as_string() ) 
 546              s = SMIME.SMIME() 
 547   
 548              #                   SIGN 
 549              if sign: 
 550                  #key for signing 
 551                  try: 
 552                      s.load_key( x509_sign_keyfile, x509_sign_certfile, callback = lambda x: sign_passphrase ) 
 553                  except Exception, e: 
 554                      self.error = "Something went wrong on certificate / private key loading: <%s>" % str( e ) 
 555                      return False 
 556                  try: 
 557                      if x509_nocerts: 
 558                          flags = SMIME.PKCS7_NOCERTS 
 559                      else: 
 560                          flags = 0 
 561                      if not encrypt: 
 562                          flags += SMIME.PKCS7_DETACHED 
 563                      p7 = s.sign( msg_bio, flags = flags ) 
 564                      msg_bio = BIO.MemoryBuffer( payload_in.as_string() ) # Recreate coz sign() has consumed it. 
 565                  except Exception, e: 
 566                      self.error = "Something went wrong on signing: <%s> %s" % ( str( e ), str( flags ) ) 
 567                      return False 
 568   
 569              #                   ENCRYPT 
 570              if encrypt: 
 571                  try: 
 572                      sk = X509.X509_Stack() 
 573                      if not isinstance(x509_crypt_certfiles, (list, tuple)): 
 574                          x509_crypt_certfiles = [x509_crypt_certfiles] 
 575   
 576                      # make an encryption cert's stack 
 577                      for x in x509_crypt_certfiles: 
 578                          sk.push(X509.load_cert(x)) 
 579                      s.set_x509_stack(sk) 
 580   
 581                      s.set_cipher(SMIME.Cipher('des_ede3_cbc')) 
 582                      tmp_bio = BIO.MemoryBuffer() 
 583                      if sign: 
 584                          s.write(tmp_bio, p7) 
 585                      else: 
 586                          tmp_bio.write(payload_in.as_string()) 
 587                      p7 = s.encrypt(tmp_bio) 
 588                  except Exception,e: 
 589                      self.error="Something went wrong on encrypting: <%s>" %str(e) 
 590                      return False 
 591   
 592              #                 Final stage in sign and encryption 
 593              out = BIO.MemoryBuffer() 
 594              if encrypt: 
 595                  s.write(out, p7) 
 596              else: 
 597                  if sign: 
 598                      s.write(out, p7, msg_bio, SMIME.PKCS7_DETACHED) 
 599                  else: 
 600                      out.write('\r\n') 
 601                      out.write(payload_in.as_string()) 
 602              out.close() 
 603              st=str(out.read()) 
 604              payload=message_from_string(st) 
 605          else: 
 606              # no cryptography process as usual 
 607              payload=payload_in

 609          payload['From'] = encoded_or_raw(self.settings.sender.decode(encoding)) 
 610          origTo = to[:] 
 611          if to: 
 612              payload['To'] = encoded_or_raw(', '.join(to).decode(encoding)) 
 613          if reply_to:

 618          if bcc: 
 619              to.extend(bcc)

 621          payload['Date'] = time.strftime("%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S +0000", 
 622                                          time.gmtime()) 
 623          for k,v in headers.iteritems():

 625          result = {}

 628                  logger.warn('email not sent\n%s\nFrom: %s\nTo: %s\nSubject: %s\n\n%s\n%s\n' % \ 
 629                                  ('-'*40,self.settings.sender,

 632              elif self.settings.server == 'gae':

 634                  if cc:

 651                                              subject=subject, body=text, **xcc) 
 652              else: 
 653                  smtp_args = self.settings.server.split(':') 
 654                  if self.settings.ssl: 
 655                      server = smtplib.SMTP_SSL(*smtp_args) 
 656                  else: 
 657                      server = smtplib.SMTP(*smtp_args)

 659                      server.ehlo() 
 660                      server.starttls() 
 661                      server.ehlo()

 940      """ 
 941      Class for authentication, authorization, role based access control. 
 942   
 943      Includes: 
 944   
 945      - registration and profile 
 946      - login and logout 
 947      - username and password retrieval 
 948      - event logging 
 949      - role creation and assignment 
 950      - user defined group/role based permission 
 951   
 952      Authentication Example: 
 953   
 954          from contrib.utils import * 
 955          mail=Mail() 
 956          mail.settings.server='smtp.gmail.com:587' 
 957          mail.settings.sender='you@somewhere.com' 
 958          mail.settings.login='username:password' 
 959          auth=Auth(db) 
 960          auth.settings.mailer=mail 
 961          # auth.settings....=... 
 962          auth.define_tables() 
 963          def authentication(): 
 964              return dict(form=auth()) 
 965   
 966      exposes: 
 967   
 968      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/login 
 969      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/logout 
 970      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/register 
 971      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/verify_email 
 972      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_username 
 973      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_password 
 974      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/reset_password 
 975      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/profile 
 976      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/change_password 
 977   
 978      On registration a group with role=new_user.id is created 
 979      and user is given membership of this group. 
 980   
 981      You can create a group with: 
 982   
 983          group_id=auth.add_group('Manager', 'can access the manage action') 
 984          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'access to manage') 
 985   
 986      Here \"access to manage\" is just a user defined string. 
 987      You can give access to a user: 
 988   
 989          auth.add_membership(group_id, user_id) 
 990   
 991      If user id is omitted, the logged in user is assumed 
 992   
 993      Then you can decorate any action: 
 994   
 995          @auth.requires_permission('access to manage') 
 996          def manage(): 
 997              return dict() 
 998   
 999      You can restrict a permission to a specific table: 
1000   
1001          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable) 
1002          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable) 
1003   
1004      Or to a specific record: 
1005   
1006          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable, 45) 
1007          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable, 45) 
1008   
1009      If authorization is not granted calls: 
1010   
1011          auth.settings.on_failed_authorization 
1012   
1013      Other options: 
1014   
1015          auth.settings.mailer=None
